title: Spotify Removes Some Comediansâ€™ Work From Streaming Service
sub_head: A push for royalty payments on comedic material sidelines work of Kevin Hart, Tiffany Haddish and hundreds of others
body:
Spotify Technology SA has removed the work of hundreds of comedians, including John Mulaney, Jim Gaffigan and Kevin Hart, amid a new fight over royalty payments.
Tiffany Haddish, Mike Birbiglia and a host of other popular acts have joined a group of entertainers trying to get paid a royalty on a copyright for jokes they wrote when they are played on radio and digital service providers like Spotify, SiriusXM, Pandora and YouTube.
